articles.author: Michael Martina, David Brunnstrom
articles.description: China is providing moorage for a U.S.-sanctioned Russian cargo ship implicated in North Korean arms transfers to Russia, according to satellite images obtained by Reuters, as U.S. concerns grow over Beijing's support for Moscow's war in Ukraine.
articles.title: Exclusive: China harbors ship tied to North Korea-Russia arms transfers, satellite images show

articles.author: Michel Rose
articles.description: President Emmanuel Macron appealed on Thursday for stronger, more integrated European defences and said the continent must not become a vassal of the United States, as he outlined his vision for a more assertive European Union on the global stage.
articles.title: 'Europe could die,' Macron warns, as he calls for stronger defences

articles.author: Jack Queen
articles.description: Donald Trump's criminal hush money trial is set to resume in New York on Thursday with a former tabloid publisher testifying about efforts to help Trump's 2016 presidential bid by burying negative stories, including an alleged affair with a former Playboy model.
articles.title: Hush money testimony expected to focus on payment to ex-Playboy model

articles.author: Simon Lewis
articles.description: U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken will meet business leaders in Shanghai on Thursday as ties between Washington and Beijing stabilise, pushing to resolve a raft of issues threatening the newly gained equilibrium between the rivals.
articles.title: Blinken to meet businesses in Shanghai as he kicks off a tough China trip

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Kremlin said on Thursday that deliveries of U.S. long-range Army Tactical Missile Systems (ATACMS) to Ukraine would not change the outcome of the war but would create more problems for Ukraine itself.
articles.title: Kremlin says U.S. long-range missiles sent to Ukraine will not change war's outcome

articles.author: Mark Trevelyan
articles.description: A third man has been detained in a bribery investigation centring on Deputy Russian Defence Minister Timur Ivanov, the Moscow court service said on Thursday.
articles.title: Construction boss accused of bribing Russian minister as scandal widens

articles.author: Laurie Chen
articles.description: Senior Chinese military officials held separate meetings with U.S. and Russian naval counterparts during a Western Pacific naval symposium in Qingdao this week, a Chinese defence ministry spokesperson said on Thursday.
articles.title: Chinese military officials met US and Russian naval officials this week

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Former Malaysian Prime Minister Mahathir Mohamad is among individuals being investigated in connection with a graft probe involving his sons, the head of Malaysia's Anti-Corruption Commission (MACC) said on Thursday.
articles.title: Malaysia ex-PM Mahathir facing anti-graft probe in a case involving his sons

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: India's Election Commission said on Thursday it has sought responses from the ruling Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) and the opposition Congress on alleged violations of poll rules by Prime Minister Narendra Modi and opposition leader Rahul Gandhi.
articles.title: India's poll panel seeks responses to complaints against Modi, Rahul Gandhi

articles.author: Camillus Eboh, Ope Adetayo
articles.description: At least 118 inmates escaped from prison after heavy rains on Wednesday night damaged the facility in Suleja near the Nigerian capital, a prison service spokesperson said.
articles.title: More than 100 inmates escape after rain damages Nigerian prison
